techmeme.title: Rumble announces a $775M investment from Tether and plans to use $525M to fund a tender offer for ~70M shares of its common stock; RUM jumps 35%+ after hours (Stephen Alpher/CoinDesk)

Google hired 100+ staffers of Magic Leap as contractors to assist with Google's work on its new Android XR OS, raising questions about the future of Magic Leap (Sylvia Varnham O'Regan/The Information)
US DOJ says a Romanian involved in Netwalker ransomware attacks has been sentenced to 20 years in prison after pleading guilty to computer fraud and wire fraud (Sergiu Gatlan/BleepingComputer)
A federal jury in Delaware finds that Qualcomm didn't violate the terms of an agreement covering Arm's chip designs that was part of the $1.4B buyout of Nuvia (Bloomberg)
How Spotify used its Perfect Fit Content program to rig its system against musicians, filling popular playlists with "ghost artists" to cut its royalty payouts (Liz Pelly/Harper's)
